8kvFayg6usp1JYJLiQJ0Aw.text: The table is in a great location close to the Tate modern. The service was friendly and efficient, but unfortunately the food looked a lot better than it tasted. The bacon tasted like old grease and the eggs were pretty flavorless. I may have ordered badly and would give it another try but a bit disappointed. Reservation is necessary for lunch time.

_rLkK04fbqKH3C-WzTaL7A.text: Great environment, and customer service. Very good meal choices and awesome taste. Easy to find. Door was a bit tough to open though lol oh and free wifi.

TOnMXuoMW9Y61tk1e54IGw.text: Solid, unspectacular, but filling Full English for £12. Looked nice, tasted fine, all in all, a resounding "Meh". What else? Ummmm, cheerful staff, some cremated bacon, and those teeny salt and pepper ramekins that everyone's dirty toilet fingers have been in.

SWaJqP6ZZ_yeyWMdiIfFlQ.text: What a great experience, fantastic English brek with a twist. My fiancee and I had the full English breakfast, I highly recommend it for your next visit to London!

photos.caption: Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom

8Q0wlSXFeSDyr8Y41PNB8A.text: I had the pancake with caramelized bananas and bacon a few weeks ago. The pancake was fantastically fluffy (nothing earth shattering, however), the bananas were spectacular, but the bacon left much to be desired. It should be an international crime to mess up bacon. They advertised it as "crispy," and it very much met that description... so much that it was overcooked and ended up overpowering the rest of the dish! GET IT TOGETHER, THE TABLE, BECAUSE BACON IS IMPORTANT.Bacon philosophy aside, let's move on. Ambiance was nice. Well lit space with bench-style seating, which made for an enjoyably communal experience. Service was just OK. Smoothies were about 8-10oz... a waste of money @ £5 (this seems to be the status quo in London, unfortunately). All in all I love brunch and mostly enjoyed my meal, so I will definitely return the next time I visit.

P5HLMvLVwi9XuL3LWqBeIg.text: Breakfast time!!Decor: There are a few LARGE/LONG tables in the restaurant and it has these wooden benches that you pull out and sit on. It's a very inviting atmosphere- so clean and simple!Service: Veryy nice people yayy!Food:- Eggs Florentine: If you've read my reviews before, I'm a picky Eggs Florentine eater because I like/hope/strive for that PERFECTLY poached egg. Well, both of mine were a tad overcooked (yolk was runny, but not explosively runny), but the dish was simple and fresh.- My friend got the Eggs Royale and her eggs were actually done quite nicely!! So I guess i was a hit or miss.- Another friend got the toast with eggs. Biggest portion of all three dishes!The tea also comes in a giant teapot thing that was really cool.I don't remember how much I paid exactly, but I do remember that it was an amount that I didn't think was of the greatest value. I wished there was a side or maybe something extra? But I guess you pay extra for the different decorBottom Line: Just a teensy less than for the value of what you pay, but it is definitely a very comfortable place to have some breakfast!

Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom. eggs royale

C9E7hGgjKl7uYfOePdYq7g.text: Been here once for brunch with some old friends. The food and milkshakes were great! The chef/owner even did the ice bucket challenge.

kIQimqeX9LL4UnRkBBohmg.text: I was in London a few weeks ago and we went for lunch. It was amazing. Claudio was so wonderful and made us feel so welcome. We then returned for dinner, I had the beef cheeks and pork belly which were amazing !! Again Claudio was there to make sure we were very well taken care of. I returned for drinks alone while my friends went to the theater , Mario and Claudio were there and made sure I was comfortable as usual. The food and atmosphere were wonderful.

BijUKhfBvh0wnpOwGN3lbg.text: The Table: it was cool; it was generally inexpensive; it's much-needed on the Southwark culinary scene.  These things are all true.But did I leave thinking to myself, "I really must come back to this place"? No.  Not particularly.I got a smoked salmon bagel, and I was expecting it to arrive warm.  I was wrong.  It arrived cold.  I ate it all.  And it was pretty tasty, all things considered.  But it just didn't excite me.  I also got an americano, which was made with Monmouth espresso blend beans, and it was a perfectly serviceable cup of coffee but nothing that blew me away.I looked around me at my fellow diners' plates and got a bit of plate envy.  Maybe I should have just got the £4 scrambled eggs on toast.  Maybe I should have got the eggs benedict.  Maybe I should have just got the muesli buffet.  I know I shouldn't have got the buttermilk pancakes, though, because what arrived at the table was a big flat pancake looking very sad with bacon nestled on top of it on a plate.  My American mind thinks "FLUFFY PANCAKES YUM!" when it reads "buttermilk pancakes", and perhaps that's my own fault.  At least there's that.  I enjoyed my slightly sweet, albeit cold, bagel with cream cheese and chilled smoked salmon more than I would have the pancakes.All this being said, if one of my friends said to me, "Larissa, let's meet at the Table for brunch this weekend", I'd say, "Okay!"So, yeah. I liked it enough.And all the baked goods on display looked divine.  I didn't realise that everything served at the Table is made in house, so I assumed (wrongly) that they were bought in from local bakeries, which is why I didn't gluttonously order one after I finished my breakfast.  Perhaps on my next visit I'll just eat pastries and drink coffee.  Because I prefer cake to real food.As any normal person does, obviously.

Yc_o7tIIIcXeLiSSTqJ4xw.text: Went on for brunch this morning and it was delicious. I'm not a fan of communal seating but the food was good enough that is definitely go back. Had the Full Borough Breakfast which was very good, especially the sausage. The Stack and Eggs Benedict also looked good.

_qhePdUj0BWGiKiNa-eFpw.text: I like the Table. It reminded me of school with their wooden long table and bench styled seating. I like the way the some of the breakfast food on the right side was displayed, so you could help your self to some oranges or muesli.I had the egg on toast with pork and leek sausages which was well presented (check the pic) and tasted delicious, and this all cost £6.I also had a mango, pineapple and orange smoothie which came late, but the chef was kind enough to give it to me for free, due to the fact I was waiting for it, for long. The smoothie would of cost £2:50.The restaurant is not far from south bank, so you can take a stroll down the Thames and go to all the touristy places down their or if your lucky see some free entertainment .

photos.caption: Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom

Y8IAYEE7RgV4b4cwGVWjFQ.text: The English Breakfast is a must have!!  Great atmosphere and friendly staff!!  Will be back next time in London.

bKZa39HI2INCenrgRCqj7Q.text: I've gone here a couple of times on the weekends for brunch. The pancakes and waffles are good, though nothing incredibly special. Instead of multiple pancakes, they give you one large pancake, which isn't super filling. However, still a solid brunch spot and I like that it has communal seating.

ZD35-Rw5-Zd-Pz2gY0JRKg.text: I came here with a friend on a friday night.  I ordered the pappardelle duck ragu.  It was really yummy and warming.  Somehow it reminded me of a dish that one of my aunts back in Bangladesh would make.  I think the bay leaf in the dish had something to do with the nostalgia.  Bay leafs are commonly used in South Asian cuisine ;) .I was pretty hungry and wanted something substantial and this definitely did the trick.For dessert I ordered the chocolate sorbet.  It was rich enough to almost pass off as an ice cream.  I liked it. On top of this, the waitresses were exceptionally friendly and accommodating and they had a DJ who played some really relaxing tunes which contributed to the lovely ambiance of the place.  We will definitely be coming back.  Next time I'm trying the veal risotto. Can't wait :)

wOhI-6rpNiZ-0O7NY3CxJA.text: Oh sweet pretension. We had breakfast here on a Friday morning before hitting a market.  We made a reservation, though it wasn't necessary.  A bit oddly, although there were only two other people eating in the restaurant, they sat us right next to them, as opposed to a table for four.  Is this part of the 'experience' of the namesake?  I don't know, but it was a little weird.We ordered a Full English, the breakfast brushetta and french toast.The Full English was average- nothing really special, nothing disappointing. They were out of the french toast so we had blueberry waffles instead- which was just a waffle with a cup of blueberries on the side and pre-poured syrup.  Kind of dry and plain.The breakfast brushetta came with (flaccid, undercooked) bacon I hadn't ordered (it's an optional add-on) and it took an extremely long time to be remade considering we were the only ones eating in the joint. The finished product was pretty tasty, though, if extremely simple (avocado and tomato slices on toast with two poached eggs). Waitress left in the middle of our meal without telling us, or apparently, anyone else.  We wanted take-away coffees, but by the time we got someone'e attention, we were just ready for the bill.  They charged me for the bacon I didn't order, but at that point I was just ready to get out and didn't bother correcting it. The opening comment is a result of the stereo system that have installed by the wall and the fact that they were playing Abercrombie & Fitch-style shit-tastic techno, extremely loudly, at 9:30 in the morning.  WTF?  We asked if they could turn it down a bit (only people in the restaurant) and they pretended to and went on with their business.  I know, I get it--- one of my least favorite things as a waitress is when one customer in the whole damned restaurant tells me I need to adjust the temperature or the music volume.  But seriously- 9:30? Techno? Empty restaurant?  Gross.Overall, a bit awkward and disappointing, and I was more than a little bit embarrassed to have recommended this place to my visitors.

X40RCb816U_ttnzf4CoO5Q.text: If you are looking for a place to have your weekend brunch look no further. Or maybe yes, so it's not crowded when I have to go! ;)DISHESI'm probably addicted to their "Table Stack", a great mix with beans, chorizo, ham on bagel and two poached eggs. It's a great mix and probably will also give you enough energy for the whole weekend.The coffee, and particularly the cappuccino, is not a good italian one, but it's quite good nonetheless.AMBIENT AND SERVICEThe ambient is excellent, with a very bright room and wooden tables, overall a very well crafted room. Most of the tables have a bench, no chairs, so mind that if you think you'll be uncomfortable.The service is excellent, very careful but also very quiet and not intrusive at all. They have also some tables outside in the rear of the place, it's on a road but it's a closed one, so you don't have any trouble caused by the traffic.I always tried this place for brunch, but given the quality of it it's probably also a great choice for lunch and dinner as well.

nFAZUU6GwXikM1vYrpIWLw.text: A regular sunday brunch place of mine for a few years now. Big fan. Lovely relaxed atmosphere. They have a nice and varied brunch menu, and the pancakes are amazing, particularly the banana, syrup and bacon. The bacon itself is worth a mention, when it's done right it's fantastic, nicely crisped and charred - however on occasion (perhaps different chef) it has an off day.One slight criticism, the pancakes have gradually been getting smaller and smaller, when i first started coming here, they crept over the edge of the plate, now they fit squarely within it with an inch to spare.

Tsy7_hxtvtAU_kKxQC8kEg.text: Amazing all around. Service is fantastic. Food is delicious. Having a table facing the window is great for relaxing and people watching. Highly recommended if you want a delicious breakfast and great place to relax.

photos.caption: Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom. Full English Breakfast

zTpvTkGCGPK8WHSo6WG8EA.text: Brunch. That perfect meal after a lie-in on the weekend when you wake ravenous for breakfast foods but realise it's time for lunch. (Or in my case this past Saturday, the well earned reward for 3 hours of cycling and fitness training...I think the lazy way is preferable though...). The Table Café puts on a good spread at reasonable prices and doesn't fill up until mid afternoon.Based off the Telegraph's list of top picks for brunch in London, Tracy L and I decided to work our way down the list with The Table Café in Southwark being our first stop.  The recommended dishes were the Table Stack (a toasted bagel with chorizo and poached eggs absolutely smothered in baked beans and a bit of hollandaise on the top) and the Sweetcorn Fritters with tomato compote. I'll give it to the Telegraph reviewers, both dishes were tasty and on the unique side of the menu. You can also get your usual range of pancakes and waffles with a wide variety of toppings as well as the Eggs series but that's standard for pretty much any brunch spot.The Table stack was fairly easy to eat with fork and knife (my biggest concern) largely due to the choice of bagel as the bread rather than a more standard bit of toast or English muffin. The elastic nature of the bagel allowed it to hold together and absorb considerably more sauce than it's carb counterparts. I have to note that the chorizo failed to make an appearance unless it was somehow blended into the beans. I would have like the spicy counter note to the rich creaminess of the eggs, sauce, and beans. Still, all in all, a good dish.The sweetcorn fritters were delicious. I'm a sucker for sweetcorn (and probably slightly biased) and these fritters were packed with juicy kernels exploding with sweet flavours. The fitter was golden brown and fried to a crispiness on the outside while maintaining a fluffy light texture on the inside. The tomato compote was full of umami and provided a great degree of acidity to enhance the sweetness of the corn.Dessert was had in the form of the Chockywockydoodah waffle which comes drenched in syrup, chocolate sauce, and marshmellows. All that needs to be said is that for two die hard deserters such as me and Tracy L, the waffle satisfied our sweet teeth without a problem and was decadent to the point where we couldn't finish. That never happens. Ever.Overall, a good experience despite a bit of a mix up on my smoothie (I order a mango and pineapple smoothie and it came out green as someone had added spinach) the customer service was spot on. Pricewise, our meal ran around £50-60 for the two of us including a drink but dishes are prices around £10-15 each so by all means an affordable option.

jrDlPcWZ2KRsDBP7W9FPBw.text: This is my hidden gem that I'm constantly taking colleagues from out of town, friends, and family and it never disappoints. The food is local, fresh, and delicious. The wine menu features out of the way quality wineries that you've probably never heard of and consistently bewilder me. The dishes are always balanced and thoughtfully presented - and the menu frequently changes. Best of all, by London standards, it's very inexpensive.I'm still waiting for the Michelin people to bestow a star on this place, it's really that good.

QRxuODtrd6mEvZQPF-Q_zw.text: Don't leave without getting the homemade banana bread! We visited this restaurant while vacationing in London and found it to be full of locals. The food was delicious and fresh. I had the smoked salmon with poached eggs and avocado toast, and I wish I could go back to London to get this meal again! Highly recommend!!

FFQJ6y5VKTmLSMGsvpoTYQ.text: Another disappointing brunch.  The Bloody Mary was downright boring and the food just average.  The room was quite packed when we got there so the service had to suffer as well.  Well, does it?  Just unfortunate to travel down there and get this.  The pictures make it look really good.  To be fair the French toast was quite good.  The beans and sauce on the other dishes was just bland though.  The service was slow and confusing but fine in the end.  Just wouldn't recommend it or will be going back again.

Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom. Salmon florentine

MHZIxnA1kOzz7CsXdMqyPw.text: Good brunch and nice staff. I really enjoyed my waffle with scrambled eggs, bacon and sausage!

J1OvBGh9Z43qVH-jiAMAow.text: The vegetarian full English is perfection! I added avocado to mine with no regrets. I'm definitely coming back to this fabulous spot on my next London trip.

QWR9z-4ff-XdbpH5ET8TNg.text: The place was absolutely PACKED for Sunday brunch, but it's run so efficiently that we were seated within 10 minutes of waiting. Awesome!Obviously, the food was amazing, and quite cheap! (Aside from the orange juice... 5 pounds?? I'm certainly not paying $7 in California for a cup of juice...)But service was excellent and my pancakes with bananas and bacon were amazing, so that's that.

W_C48kSEajWoEMHd-aNkzA.text: Very good place for a nice breakfast before going to visit the Tate! We had full English and bruchetta and they were both very nice. Pancakes were amazing as well. Fresh juices and coffees. If you are not so much into brunch you can also chose from salads or burgers!Nice staff and if you are lucky with the weather you can even seat outside.

5BMI3mY6bn2W0zoOD7CkQQ.text: Fluffy and crispy waffles, crispy bacon, fluffy eggs washed down with strong roast black coffee. In my jetlag haze, the waitresses were attentive, polite, and quick with service. A nice place for brunch if you're in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom

zucrKgD12XG8dDqPXA_kCQ.text: The Eggs Benedict was great. Also tried a new tea; ginger, lemon and mint leaf. Did not disappoint.The eggs broke perfectly, and the balance between each ingredient was very good. The egg yolk perfectly covered both pieces and made every bite delicious.The tea was also a great blend. The mint leaves were a bit difficult to not sip at the end but that's expected. I do suggest a single teaspoon of the provided sugar.Let the photos do the talking if you doubt me. 4 stars due to pricing seems high but the view and location is likely the reason.

Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom. Ready to Eat

2raCo8X_juJemWVfN2cfwA.text: Came here while on holiday in London to try a "full English breakfast." It was perfectly delicious. The Full English: best sausages I've ever had, so savory. The beans were also rich in flavor. True blue waffles: there's something special about their waffle batter, because it tastes different from other waffles I've had - in an excellent way. So good. And fresh blueberries!Amazing breakfast. My only complaint is there wasn't more sausage with the full breakfast!

Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom. True blue waffles

2CxB9I9gwdxkye5zwN6rbw.text: I got the "All day Breakfast" with waffle and it was pretty good. Everything taste good and was just perfect. My husband got the "True Blue" and he enjoyed it as well.

photos.caption: Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom. All Day Breakfast. Very crispy bacon.

W8EJdSgl7oEPoqLRCbleug.text: Wife and I enjoyed Saturday brunch at The Table. Relaxed atmosphere, friendly hosts, and absolutely fantastic food. Probably the single best waffle I've ever had, outstanding sausage, and "The Stack," which is essentially a pile of protein and hollandaise atop a bagel. The Table is fantastic, and we'll definitely be back.

lVuyzSi_27qANJr816dsxw.text: High quality food. Great coffee. Wonderful service. I recommend the waffle with banana and bacon.

sXhO5w6MsHsrqVVF6OBy-w.text: This place is amazing! Second time coming here, and the food just gets better. We came here for breakfast with a relatively big group. All of us had a different dish, and each was incredibly delicious. It is a small restaurant, so be sure to book a reservation. The staff is incredibly accommodating and friendly, as they were very open to our mild food substitutions. Definitely go for brunch!!

-5M0Rvq-qiGQmMVbnIpj6Q.text: The last time I was here it was very quiet (usually very busy!) so enjoyed the fact we didn't have to share a table. I usually have breakfast or brunch there (eggs benedict: yum!) but this time it was lunch. I went for the duck confit burger and fries, it was amazing! Might try dinner there next time :)

photos.caption: Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom. The duck confit burger and fries were to die for! Yummmmm

w_HD8z9zxdwuMx5u1NBkcw.text: Cute place. Cramped and noisy on a Saturday morning. Perfectly pleasant staff. Food was good. Pretty on the plate and filling.

photos.caption: Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom

a5TN2_MCmuUxhiBlZ9e6Lg.text: I've said this before in some of my reviews, I rarely try to give out five-star reviews unless the place does something remarkable.  The Table is one of those places.This review is strictly of their breakfast offerings, we didn't experience the lunch or dinner. We found this restaurant close to our hotel (near Blackfriars) thanks to Yelp and boy am I glad that we did, because it turned into a morning ritual for us.It's a very nice and clean restaurant with a very friendly staff.  That right there was good enough in my books for three to four stars, but then add the quality of the breakfast food, BAM! Up to five, with one exception.I can't say it enough, the eggs benedict, along with a shared side of either one of their delicious pancakes or waffles were just simply, AMAZING.  Add their freshly brewed coffee to that, and it's game over.  It's not to often than I am completely satisfied in all aspects at a restaurant, but The Table is honestly just that damn good.  The only negative aspect in my opinion is the table layouts when the place is busy (which is often).  In retrospect, we should've just made reservations each morning but didn't.  The tables are all connected horizontally with benches on each side that sit two people.  I wasn't a fan of sharing a bench with a stranger, but oh well.Next time we return to London, we will definitely be coming here.

5nb4jrVVlmq6O5YV27-pRw.text: Perfect place for a Sunday brunch. I've only been once but I know this place has a loyal following as there was quite a queue outside even though the temperature was close to freezing!I usually look at menus and often decide what I'll order before arriving at a new place but on their website they have the weekday menu and the sweetcorn fritters I wanted weren't on the weekend menu. I'll have to go back during the week some time. I ordered the eggs florentine and it was delicious. I asked for the Hollandaise on the side and they kindly obliged. I ordered mustard and it's one of the best mustards I've ever tasted! I've tried to find it in supermarkets and online, but unfortunately I haven't found it yet. My friend asked for the name of the brand -The Olive Tree? If anyone knows it, please let me know.

CSfcRNVXNLBVg5uYtxtmsQ.text: We shared a vegetable platter, which was delicious and packed with local goodness and nice flavours, but not as much food as one might have hoped for the price. I had a delicious local wheat ale and was happy to have found a place that paid attention to such things. The service was friendly and fairly attentive, and sitting in the cool, calming, architectural space was the perfect respite. With a one-day stopover in London and a plan to mosey from Westminster to the Tate we ended up starving on Southwark and turned to Yelp for help, which led us here, and it was just what we needed. So 4 happy stars and a tip of the hat to London Yelpers who did not lead us astray!!

Q4uxjThZzhx_AAgqu5peNw.text: Summary:+ Great weekend brunch/ breakfast at a trendy and casual café + That pretty much sums up all... Overall: I don't know what else I can possibly add to the super concise summary above not to mention milliards of reviews from dedicated and well-informed yelpers on this page. Oh, did I say this place is great? I probably have...The food at The Table Café is without a doubt of top quality among restaurants that serve brunch/ breakfast. It is also a very stylish café with modern wooden furniture and bare concrete that make this place look like a gallery of a modern artist. The large windows bring in a lot of natural light into the large open space. The café serves famous brunch on Saturdays and Sundays. There is usually a queue outside but I have never waited for more than 5 minutes. Sometimes you have to share a long table with other people. (Majority of tables are long ones.) I have tried eggs dishes, pancakes and waffles so far and I can tell you they are all good. Oh, the eggs. So soft and tender. Before the perfect hollandaise sauce I surrender. Wait, I just rhymed there! It's so good that it makes me want to pull of some haiku although I have no idea how. My only trouble is that the portion is not so big here. And I eat a lot. So sometimes I have to get an egg dish AND a pancake (or a waffle) to fill me up. I have also been here for a party of a friend (the café also does event hire) and the food there was lovely too. I haven't had lunch or dinner but I'm sure they are good too.

photos.caption: Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom. The Table Cafe_EggBenedict

N1EXd3UdtW65aOEBPpmctA.text: I would rate this place 5 star if you're going for the pancakes.  It's really great - fluffy yet with a good bite, solid flavor.  Carmelized banana is expertly done with a nice bitter sweetness, and the crispy bacon with the perfect savory touch.  Definitely would go back for the pancakes. However, other items on the menu were thoroughly disappointing.  I had their burger and french toast and I would give both 2 stars.  Burger - It was completely overcooked and bone dry.  At midpoint it was just grey grey grey.  I don't know what percent mince they use but they may need to up the fat content because even towards the end I was experiencing zero drippage.  Fail.  Their brioche was stale, dry, and rough with no bite at all.  It tasted like they were feeding me gluten free bread but without the benefits of it actually being gluten free.  The pickled onions completely overpowered my palate and I couldn't taste my meager ration of sauce or cheese.  Bacon was pretty good though.  The flavors may have blended better had the meat been more juicy, but at this execution nothing came together.  Granted I came in at a later time so it may have been an off cook, but at 18 pounds for a coffee and burger I find this inexcusable. French toast - I'm not sure but I think they use the same rough brioche that they use in their burgers (?) They make a good attempt at flavor with a healthy dose of cinnamon and tart yogurt, but because of their low ball brioche game the texture is all wrong.  Manages to be rough and dry yet soggy at the same time with none of the custardy yumness of a good french toast. This place is a one trick pony that does awesome pancakes but the off item are bad enough I don't have the courage to order anything else.... A very volatile 3 star average.

sNgtxoPmlZAPu7_klWN3_w.text: Great food and service the eggs are cooked to perfection, nice corner with a few tables to sit outside.  The food had great texture and tast and looked amazing, thank you.

photos.caption: Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom

Nk28evxy1ck77xJt5jOphw.text: This is definitely going into my hidden gems list of best brunch places in London. It's not posh or a one-of-a-kind experience, but more of the i-will-come-back-often type.Pancakes were delicious, nice and fluffy. Pumpkin one was especially good. Prices were very reasonable for food, slightly pricey for coffee and drinks.What was amazing value were the extra off menu side dishes. We ordered extra mushrooms and scrambled eggs. They came as huge side portions, and for only £2.50 each. Definitely get extra sides if you're hungry, or just want to pig out a bit.

8UwZocxjeh2YGIVhorW2sQ.text: American pancake lovers and crispy bacon addicts rejoice! This place offers a little home away from home breakfast action. And not just during traditional breakfast/brunch hours either since they offer an all day every day breakfast menu. Legit breakfast for dinner? Score! Before you get too excited, you can only take advantage of breakfast for dinner on weekdays since they're only open for brunch on weekends (til 4:30pm). Came here for Sunday brunch at 1pm. Sunny and inviting space a few blocks from Southwark tube station. Didn't have to wait for a table, which was good because they don't have a bar area you can wait at.They know how to do pancakes - massive, fluffy, fresh, warm, moist and decadent. I had the buttermilk pancake topped with crispy bacon, caramelised banana and Canadian maple syrup. Crispy bacon is hard to find round these parts so that sealed the deal for me. Haven't found better pancakes or bacon yet in London (granted, I've only been here a month)A downside to this spot is that they run out of certain items on the menu (both of our first choice options were no longer available) so you may be disappointed if you had your heart set on something specific.

photos.caption: Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom. Buttermilk pancake topped with crispy bacon, caramelised banana and Canadian maple syrup

2ecSvoocQ1hp-7wPnLFJfA.text: We had breakfast there this morning/early afternoon and it was truly wonderful! The waffles with the carmelized bananas and maple syrup were excellect. Waffles were light with right amount of crispness.

c2MSgC3wJaHuPiydp19K2w.text: Amazing small yet varied menu. Very cute and medium sized so go early or make a reservation. Drinks come very slow but food was quick and great quality. Highly recommend. Service was adequate.

photos.caption: Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom. Amazing small yet varied menu. Very cute and medium sized. Food was quick and great quality. Service was adequate. The Table Cafe

B9oQYPfGj0d6Ba3DAtnjcA.text: We tried to come here tonight at about 21:05 and they said they were closed. The reason I am giving a 1 star review is because I have recently moved here from New York and one thing that I don't appreciate is restaurants advertising that they are open until a certain time (in this case 22:30) and being close much earlier then that. We waked a fair amount to get here and it just seems that this might be the norm but I want to let others know that they do not stay open until their advertised times. For this I doubt I will try the food as I don't want to waste my time for a place that might not be open when we get there.

9y0BkECwU6la3nFyA_GltA.text: Decent food. Nothing special for the price. The service however was pretty poor. Our server, Giorgia was very unfriendly and seemed to hate her job. There was a long wait to get a table and for service, not because there were alot of people, but because the servers were just inattentive, slow and rude. Im surprised by the high ratings. The food was just okay. Find somewhere else if you can. Oh and we saw the busyboy argue with guests at three different tables while we were there. Not very professional. The greeter was very nice however.

Y-5XRZHTBBwuTNb0NGiNtA.text: THIS. PLACE. DOE. This is my Saturday-morning "ok we totally made out last night but I was drunk and I'm sorry you're in love with me but I'm not so Imma buy you brunch to apologize for stringing you along" place. Why it works? A few reasons: The eggs are always runny, the pancakes fluffy and ready to take in all that nectar ( yeah ok, dont read into it) and it shows you're that down to earth gal who's not counting macros on the weekend and yeah you can hang with the boys and eat the waffles too. Wassup. Also. Outdoor seating totes cool cause they got the heaters and what not. Smokers rejoice.

tU1x8yCFqjmbD0J-Pj3BTA.text: I had the full English two days in a row because the other spot I was going to was closed. It was really good, really fresh, and really hot the first time. But the second time it came out way to quickly after I ordered. Like less than 3 minutes. My food was still tasy but it was lukewarm and the yolks were solid not runny. Other than that excellent food!

nOPv5xz5vMiANjof_Ejoew.text: Trendsetter that he pretends not to be, Jamie W. actually led us to this bright, modern spot right near our trendy hotel in Southwark (photo: bit.ly/1gxVOx2). Good work, Jamie, because this turned out to be a rather smashing place to get a hearty breakfast full of fresh local ingredients. Despite the mostly communal-table set-up, we managed a space for ourselves which probably gave us subconscious self-approval to order more food than we deserved. But hey, we were on vacation, and the only thing we planned that entire day was riding the London Eye. After all, it takes a lot of energy standing in those bubble cars for a half-hour while it rotates.So many temptations. Jamie went for the £ 12.00 Borough Full English Breakfast, a hearty new-jack take on the traditional plate with two fried eggs on toast, bacon, pork-and-leek sausage, slow-cooked baked beans, grilled tomato, and herb mushrooms (photo: bit.ly/1l0nZbf). Quite a smorgasbord with each item quite delicious. As a chaser, he also went for the steamy-good £ 3.90 Hot-Toasted Croissant with Gruyere and Sliced Tomato (photo: bit.ly/1hGy8Mj). What's not to like about butter, cheese and tomato banding together for the sole purpose of edible enthrallment? I ordered the £ 9.00 Breakfast Bruschetta (photo: bit.ly/1nnGp7i).Sliced plum tomatoes, avocado, two poached eggs, some chopped basil with olive oil, and "grilled streaky bacon" were piled precariously on a grilled wedge of sourdough. It really hit the spot, and it could have been enough on a more less belly-inflated day. But no, I was lured by the sight of the £ 7.00 Hot-Iron Waffle with Blueberries and Cream (photo: bit.ly/1iQXpPc). That was for me. Believe it or not, it was incredibly light like it was flash-fried in the iron and dolloped with the cream to cool it down. What a satisfying meal to start a spontaneous day traipsing London. If we were full-time Brits, we would surely be back because Bob's your uncle, mate.FOOD - 4 stars...first-rate breakfast fare really hits the spotAMBIANCE - 4 stars...clean, modern space befitting the trendy neighborhoodSERVICE - 3.5 stars...effective though a tad coolish, a bit clippedTOTAL - 4 stars...probably one of the better bets for breakfast in London

QvAF0oWiZQgc9cpkxecXjw.text: Stumbled across this breakfast heaven while gallivanting our way to the Tate. Brunch is my favourite genre of food, and I can confidently say that The Table wins best eggs benedict that I've had in the UK, AND best coffee I've had since moving to London from NZ. The eggs, perfectly caramel in texture. The hollandaise moist and zingy. The bacon lay across the tender muffins like the goddess it is, all crispy and nonchalant. My partner's corn fitters were little parcels of joy, collaborated with a bunch of deliciousness. Service was quick, fast and efficient, and as busy as it was we were well looked after so don't be put off by the thought of having to wait - these guys know exactly what they're doing!

photos.caption: Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom. This is my idea of breakfast heaven

fKUqKD01ZMRhvFDaXCdMEQ.text: First, they are open on Sunday! That alone deserves a star. I had the Full English breakfast with Earl Grey tea. I'm in love with English breakfasts so my expectations were high. I was not disappointed. Food presentation was very nice for a casual restaurant. Though the sausage and eggs were nothing extraordinary, the beans in tomato sauce were the best beans I've ever had!! The dish also came with the best mushroom I've ever had; it was big and juicy (sorry no elegant way of putting that). The tea was also impressive. It's actually because of this experience that I now prefer Earl Grey and ordered it wherever I went for the rest of my trip. I also loved the clean, modern, and slightly hipster decor of the place. Service was great, and they took our American credit card without any problems. Though we weren't the only Americans dining there, this place is not really touristy. And you can definitely find cheaper breakfast elsewhere, but they're often cash only.

photos.caption: Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom. The Full English w/ amazing beans & mushroom!!

Z5cEDIrq6iHJu2y6pZ6hWA.text: Superb breakfast: full English be banana-bacon pancakes for my son. Perfect relaxed and welcoming service. We'd come back here in a minute!

iOIhMs7jeFYnDh37YAL_lw.text: Book in advance!!!Turned up for Sunday brunch, as did everyone else, and waited for a while until space came available. Food was pretty slow (because there wasn't a spare seat in the place probably), but I enjoyed it. Love the outside area under the umbrellas and heaters. Massive fan of that indeed.Also love that they use Valrhona chocolate. Hmmm...

photos.caption: Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom. Outside, but warm under the heaters :)
Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom. Local produce!  :)
Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom. Tasty mushroom burger with full breakfasts meat burger and pancakes in background

d3AIMAL4tl_HF1HPQBM8kg.text: Really well done breakfast at The Table. I ordered the Full English and enjoyed their upscale interpretation of the original. All components of the dish were well conceived and well executed. I particularly liked the garlicky sausage (huge, the size of a bratwurst), the portobello with pesto, and the chipotle beans. Don't let the unique-sounding combination scare you off, it all worked wonderfully and I'd order it again. Also very well done was the cappuccino.The rest of the breakfast menu looked great. I admired the plates of all of my neighbors especially the avocado toast and eggs Benedict. The atmosphere at The Table has a neighborhood feel. There were a mix of families, business folks, friends, and a sprinkling of tourist such as myself.I'd like to give the Table 5 stars but there were two imperfections that must be taken into account. I think that my Full English breakfast was supposed to come with bacon, it did not. To be fair, due to the large portion of food, I didn't need any more and didn't ask about it. So, there wasn't a chance for them to clarify or fix it. Also, the service was a little on the cold side, not particularly welcoming. With that said, I will return the next time I'm in London.

c27eqWUiKLUS5fQiMxlysg.text: My first trip to London started off marvelous thanks to this restaurant. The environment, the staff, and last but not least, the food was amazing. I can now cross out having a typical English breakfast off my to-do list. I had the English breakfast which was really filling. With some Earl Grey tea and orange juice. From the time we ordered to our plate being on my table was ridiculously fast. If you blinked, you missed it. I will highly recommend this restaurant to all my traveling friends. Nothing bad to say about this restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom. Traditional English breakfast.

25MetUeNohdp4JQLX3J_dQ.text: Glad to find a brunch spot that has vegan breakfast! The vegan breakfast was good but could used with smashed avocado on the toast instead of just a plain piece on it. I asked for extra toast to which I was told the kitchen staff is on a break and won't be back for 10 mins by then I would have been done eating! The banana,walnut pancake was just ok - nothing special. What was a little annoying was that the manager refused to give us cappuccino's instead of the espresso shot on yelp checkin. The espresso was £2.70 and the cappuccino was £3. We told her to charge us the difference and give us a cappuccino to which she said no. I thought it was a small adjustment to ask for especially when we offered to pay the difference!

IW7hzMFdROxO7XIchjgz4w.text: Normal price,Relaxed atmosphere,Very, very good food,Cheerful service,Amazing tea!I love The Table!

Nfv2FoltYGBg4ONr7fezlA.text: Great brunch spot right behind Tate Modern ! The menu is well varied (vegan and veggie options as well), original and healthy. Coffee is beautifully prepared. It is quite busy before 2.00pm on weekends and they do not take any bookings so make sure you avoid the crowd !

z9MOP01mxyleGw3CM6ea5A.text: I've wanted to try brunch at The Table for a LONG time, so when the opportunity presented itself I was up and out with a spring in my step! We arrived just before 10.30, and only had to wait a couple of minutes for a table. It didn't take long for a queue to start forming behind us though, so I would suggest getting there before 10.30 if you can.We were greeted by a hip young man with a ridiculous moustache, who was only averagely polite. Once we were seated we had a great waitress who was fast and efficient, and we found the service to be like this throughout our visit. They certainly seemed to know what they were doing! The interior is very simple, nothing to write home about, and it was quite busy/noisy but that was to be expected. They draw a crowd for a reason. The coffees were good, but not quite as strong as I would have liked. However, my friend's tea came in an ENORMOUS tall pot, and seemed almost endless! She was very happy indeed. The food itself was pretty much flawless. I went for The Stack, the Jason Statham of brunches. How could I not? Beans mixed with chorizo and ham hock, layered between two halves of a muffin and topped with two velvety, perfectly poached eggs and hollandaise sauce. It was amazing. Super delicious, well considered and only a tiny bit too big so I didn't feel too stuffed all day... The beans could have done with being just a touch saucier, and there could have been a slightly more generous dollop of hollandaise, but those little niggles aside, it was perfection. My friends had the full English and eggs florentine, and were both very pleased. The prices were fair. My stack was £11, the eggs were around £8-£9, which is all very standard for good brunch spots in London, and this is one of the tastiest. My only negative comment would be to suggest that if a table is going to be placed right in front of the drinks fridges then they should have doors on and not be open, it was just a little bit chilly in our seats! Overall, I left very content, as did my friends, and I would certainly go back if I had cause to be in the area again. If I'm staying North though, I'll stick to the Shoe Shop...

photos.caption: Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom. Eggs Florentine, everything on the side...
Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom. Full English
Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom. The Stack

6-MOsZEsY2WVmXHqQ28UnA.text: I don't normally leave reviews, but felt compelled by the rudeness of the waitress working on this morning of 8/25.  Our waiter was helpful and considerate but was certainly annoyed at the waitress and her shortness not only with customers but with him as well.  Food was solid.

fAHsqkdMhfjylhWwgPwJkQ.text: My 100th review!!!  I had to think long and hard on what to review to mark this occasion. It had to be pretty damn special, and The Table wins the spotlight for a number of reasons. 1. In July 2013, Yelp hosted an epic event: Yelp's Key to the Bankside, where 13 keys were hidden around southbank, with a chance to win a trip to Amsterdam.  I found a key there, and won a generous champagne brunch for 4 at The Table (along with a tour of the garden where their fresh herbs and vegetables are sourced from).  This was also home of the key that won me my trip to the 'Dam!2.  The servers at The Table are lovely.  When I arrived at the Table to hunt for the key, I think only 1-2 workers knew of the contest that was going on.  I was asking the servers if they've seen anything hidden around (they actually had no clue).  But they were very accommodating in letting me lurk around the restaurant (I did order a tea and snack), and I was trying my best not to weird out their customers by trying to look under the tables / benches, etc.  They even suggested for places for me to look that I might have missed.  Low and behold, I eventually found the key, the servers were ecstatic, I was happy :) 3. Food is amazingly good, and the lunch/dinner menu changes often based on the fresh ingredients available. The brunch items are amazing, and luckily we sampled several things off the menu with the Yelp prize.  We tried the corn fritters with poached egg, the table stack, a few bennies, and some waffles (chockywockydoodah and banoffee).  We really wanted to try the mixed grill, but it was so popular that it was sold out by the time we ordered (around 11:45am!).  Everything was delicious, and I really enjoyed the ham hock baked beans.  The brindisa hot chocolate is pretty good too. Their waffles - oh good God, their waffles are amazing.  My favorite is the banoffee, but I'd have an affair with the waffles alone and eat them bare naked.  Crispy on the outside, oh-so-fluffy on the inside. We ended up buying a waffle iron, and after trying numerous recipes, it still doesn't come anywhere close to the one at The Table. WHATS THE SECRET, DAMMIT?! 4. On my 3rd trip to The Table, I had breakfast with my cousin from Oz, whom I finally met after 23 years. Food is still great. We had a grand time, and he said it was one of the better meals he's had in London.5. The Table Cafe believes in using sustainable resources where they can, and they do their part in several ways when it comes to sourcing ingredients, and using enviro-friendly products.  However, one thing that REALLY sticks is that they actively support the local community by having fresh herbs and vegetables sourced from a community garden down the street, which is run by a charity that focuses on helping the homeless.  St Mungo's focuses on doing what they can to help the homeless and those who are at risk, by housing them, helping and caring for them, and have preventative measures to keep these people off the street.  Putting Down Roots is a gardening project aimed at supporting their clients, by providing the opportunity for them to gain skills, qualifications, and voluntary work through therapeutic gardening. The fresh vegetables were being given away to the public, but I believe The Table was the first company to step up and make a deal with them to be their regular supplier.  Its a win-win situation: The Table supports the community; local fresh veggies are being used; the charity makes some revenue, which goes back to funding more community food growing spaces through London - and creates further opportunities to keep the homeless more engaged and off the street.Amazing.Thanks to The Table for having great food, and being such a strong supporter to the local community. You win. More info here on The Table's values on sustainability and suppliers: thetablecafe.com/supplie…More info here on St Mungo's Putting Down Roots initiative: mungos.org/pdr

ncdZNIthUlkC_1F9dnOtbA.text: I came in with some friends for brunch - I only had coffee as I had to dash off, but it was a good latte. The breakfasts looked very good, and got approving murmurs (this was not the first visit for one of my friends).It is done up nicely, with bare wood, light colour colours and a view through to the kitchen. There are large windows looking onto the road outside which keep it light and airy as well. The seats aren't that comfortable for a long sit-down, which is a slight downside.

DeVtDFFlohs3RXjcmYYchg.text: Hooray for yet another solid brunch spot close to our flat! The Table was a lovely and welcoming spot on a cold winter Sunday. Normally, I'm not crazy about shared tables while dining, but chairs felt spaced out enough so there was plenty of room, and we didn't feel like we were joining the diners next to us! Despite a crowded dining area, we seated straight away.Staff were friendly, without being too invasive, and I really liked being seated adjacent to the open kitchen - as a foodie I love watching the chefs work the line! The menu was simple, with classic brunch staples like the full English (and the veggie version), and a few Table twists - The Stack and some tantalizing waffle creations. My Veggie Full English was absolutely delicious! Perfectly poached eggs, rich and flavourful beans, buttery spinach and herby, meaty portobello mushroom. Yum! The only slight let down was the halloumi cheese. When I grill this at home, I like a bit more golden brown colour to give it a little more texture. Also, my plate could have been a bit warmer, my food seemed to go cold rather quickly. Lovely hot coffee and warm atmosphere made for a great choice for breakfast today. Our neighbours ordered a rather delicious looking waffle coated in chocolate - definitely will try on our next visit!

Cw1EGjwVkctntnSmivGElw.text: The food here was absolutely delicious! The waffles with blueberries and cream were spot on and their full English was probably the best I had while in London.

AFlgV95sr_cjDweYc2s9_w.text: Fastest and most delicious breakfast we had in London. I tried the sweet corn fritters and asked for my eggs scrambled soft. My boyfriend had the English breakfast and both of us had coffees. He enjoyed his English breakfast but I was super impressed with my meal. The corn fritters were sorta weird and dry but the eggs were PERFECT. I I've for soft scrambled eggs and they nailed it. The coffees were also absolutely delicious and creamy. The service was great even though there were only 2 servers in the whole place; we didn't have to wait for anything. Definitely a must on the South bank.

0NNTT5IpBOT4HOb__c0-Cw.text: This is a solid place for a good traditional breakfast. Compared to other places the sausage was well seasoned with herbs and the eggs and today were perfectly done. My only suggestion is to not order the american coffee. It's very watery. Instead go for a lattee.

photos.caption: Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom. English breakfast with black pudding side

AptxKvZBRQW7wAT8O6j52A.text: So I love this place. a thousand times over and over.  It is on the street behind the Tate Modern and we came in at what was of course a very busy time - brunch on a saturday! We luckily got seated within 10 minutes and ordered a coffee, freshly squeezed orange juice, and a cappucino.  My cappucino was strong yet smooth, just like I like my man :)We ordered a waffle with maple syrup and eggs royale, which had a homemade biscuit bottom. DELISH!! I am so happy that I found this place and can not wait to go back on another amazing sunny day where i can avail myself of some of those mimosas :)

XH1WRFD_EaGAwbQBpJ2b1Q.text: Had the full English breakfast. Beans were delicious, sausages were a little mealy in texture but had good flavor, eggs were perfect, lovely charred tomato and mushroom was a great addition to the meal. Service was nice but I did have to ask for water twice. Overall very nice but after reading reviews, I think I was expecting a lot more.

NEtKU7YO3ByibHWvkS0bcA.text: Can someone please just start up a charity for me to have breakfast/brunch here every morning? It would be ever so greatly appreciated. For real though- this place does an incredible breakfast/brunch, and somehow, although I hear horror stories galore about having to wait ages for a table (at The Table, ha! aren't they so witty!), every time I've come, the wait has been either non-existent or minimal. Which thank god, because I don't know how long I could wait to get my hands on their insane poached eggs and waffles! Although I've never tried their meat-based breakfast options, many brunching companions have, and all can testify to their goodness (honestly, seeing their Full Borough breakfast, I have, on occasion doubted my choice of vegetarian-ness). In addition, they do great lunch burgers and their fixed lunch is fabulous (although, with the fixed menu, it can be a little hit-and-miss if they happen to be serving something you don't particularly like). A particularly positive point of The Table's, is that when you order tea, instead of just bringing you a cup of tea, as most places tend to do, they bring you an entire pot of it (it helps that their pot is nice as well... what doesn't this place get right?)! But, if you're not a tea fan, don't worry- everything else is good too!

dSS8Ak1U7l7Fu72hIdCz6A.text: Great place!  I had the banana waffles and a cappuccino. Everything was hot and delicious. The service was good, very friendly staff.  You can watch the cooks working. We walked there from the Hilton tower bridge hotel on Tooley street. It was easy to find and a nice stroll through the city. There's a bus stop a few steps away.

photos.caption: Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom

4brm3ZN-Ocwaz1ffCX8VVg.text: I went here in April for a weekend brunch. Everything on their menu looked extremely delicious. I wish I had more room in my tummy to try everything! The communal seating was fun and the coffee was the perfect hangover antidote. As for food, I was able to eat about half of the chocolate, yogurt, and berries pancakes. They were kind of crispy on the outside and warm and soft on the inside. Not totally the same as American pancakes but still delicious nonetheless! They were also HUGE so I couldn't eat the whole thing, sadly. My date had the Sweetcorn fritter and poached eggs dish. I snagged a bite (or two). I loved the savory flavors all together. Overall, this place is worth visiting again when I'm back in London! Highly recommended for brunch in Southwark!

DBkumHEW0Bo-erINSx3ijA.text: Great service, great food, great interior and all that at a great price! My mint tea looked like a bowl of mint soup and was absolutely delicious. We had English and veggie breakfast both amazing. Solid five stars.

photos.caption: Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom

4GViE-h2isgyHCmTY0VmoA.text: Fantastic choice for brunch and one of the best in the area. Many of the products are sourced locally from Borough Market and surrounding SE1. The burger is excellent; juicy, tasty and cooked to perfection, not to mention the fantastic sauce they put on it - no clue what it is but can't get enough! Does all the usual brunch favourites including all the 'Benedicts', pancakes, waffles etc. Can sometimes be a short queue but worth the wait!

RmAl8shV7OxtphvLmdQv_Q.text: Great decor and now outdoor seating is also available. Staff are very friendly and attentive. Sometimes there could be a queue, but given the vast space, you will be served quickly.

5WGWdnV6ipA5trhAGIOFZQ.text: Can't rate this place highly enough, great good, quick service and friendly staff - what more can you ask for.

photos.caption: Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom. Amazing buttermilk pancake with burnt lemon

BWKIUXR0qFJllpYpdRi6BQ.text: Sorry, Table, I just did not enjoy your food. And I really wanted to - because the place looks very promising, airy atmosphere, canteen-like arrangement of tables, nice, woody interior...Sardines - poor sardines - were appauling - bitter, burnt and something else. The steak was alright, it had nothing special about it.Service? They took some time, but to be fair we were a fairly large group of people.

gxFjt8hjb6zGFYCNfJ9lHw.text: The Table cafe has a rather boring name and a mediocre to none front decor but if you could get past that you'll find yourself inside of a lovely breakfast spot. It's located on the rather lively Southwark St where you can find many other cafes but below I'll try to urge you to choose this one by telling my story.I was here the other day, came in by 9am and the place was rather full for a Saturday morning. I was feeling quite gourmand-ish and ordered the Full English. My friend went modestly with the pretty standard scrambled eggs option. My place came quite big and full of the assorted items of the English breakfast - all of it was delicious. I usually hate beans but I ate almost all of them so I guess this tells of the great food they serve here. My friend and I were both quite thankful and satisfied with our stay at The Table. Loved the food, loved the staff, end of story.

rJflv-6wb-STlIaEgaVZQg.text: Nice place but very bad brunch.Pancake with grilled lemon was greasy and not good at all. Same for the waffle or the full English breakfast.

QDaJjSYQn5oqcq3MA7tTRA.text: I discovered the Table through the joys of Yelp, and I love it when a place lives up to it's reviews.  We went on a Friday night, and the place looked great, with fairy lights creating a fun atmosphere.  Waiting for my party to arrive I perused the cocktail menu and settled on one, and was slightly put out when I went to order and they said there was no one on duty who could make cocktails... (The same applied later to coffees, but the fresh mint tea I had instead was very tasty) The ability to have breakfast at dinner time was appealing, and the food was really tasty, lovely and fresh.  A definite must visit, just hope the bar man is there when you visit!

Y5tLAfsNycVx5bZwqKsJ8Q.text: Great food and service!  Salmon and scrambled eggs were top notch.  Be sure to get the freshly squeezed orange juice and mocha.

MQ4vW3KWdT39LVK48su4vg.text: Not a tourist trap. A really good, local, place. We had breakfast there before going to the Tate modern. It was delicious.

jm_OSbWbb14KJFMCJB_-0g.text: This is generally a busy restaurant, but we came at an off hour and were seated within 10 minutes. I had the eggs Benedict with avocado. Incredible! My wife described her brioche French toast as "amazing."

HEGZEJ_KbSl21ZQvtwd7tw.text: The Table has been rated one of the better places to eat breakfast/brunch in London. While I don't have much experience with breakfast/brunch in London, I would definitely go back here. Everything is farm to table and organic which is great. They had lots of menu options and it's located not far from the Southwark tube station. It was fairly crowded on a Saturday morning, but there didn't seem to be much of a wait at any point. Everything was great and I would recommend it. Dog friendly too!

photos.caption: Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom

Yd1WFlHMlJM3SKmhmMarrg.text: Relaxed atmosphere for brunch, price is fair.  Open cooking area.Relaxed atmosphere with heated outdoor seating, takes credit card.  Water provided.  Coffee good.  Full English was fine, service was efficient.Have 2 restrooms for use through side door.

Vtz94h7QwP_vOVQj6XwX9A.text: Such a cute little place with delicious food! I got the eggs Benedict, and it was yummy!

sIRD5facDAD7SfjaRLv0bg.text: Really loved it here! I would recommend making a reservation for brunch as it gets quite busy starting from around 10:30. The vegan borough was delicious and I think I preferred it to the brioche French toast. I couldn't help but eye the blueberry pancake from the table beside mine since it looked so good! Staff was friendly and environment was lovely :)

76ufpIK0lSF1cJsOOLF0Tw.text: I went out of my way to find my way here based on Yelp and this place's great reviews. Unfortunately, the menu had been updated so I what I wanted to eat wasn't available. The service was great and the food was pretty good as well. It's unfortunate that they don't serve black pudding with the full English breakfast, but it was still good.

photos.caption: Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom. Waffle & bacon on top and a full English breakfast on the bottom.

BWkLZK1UK0JZWOPF5mLpEQ.text: Wow! Did this place exceed my expectations. Sat outside. The IPA on tap was delicious. When I ordered a burger medium rare the server advised me that all burgers were required to be well done and recommended the steak. The steak has perfectly medium rare with a delicious sauce. One of the highlights of my recent work trip. Would absolutely recommend this place to anyone.

cx1lzG7VSuULsCviNTryTg.text: Near my hotel and the customers looked happy so we went in to give the Table a shot and loved it so much we went twice.Pancakes were delicious, they're thinner than American style but thicker than crepes.   The Benedict was tasty and presentation far better than I've seen in the states.The setting bright and airy, fresh tulips on every table.And the STAFF was so amazing.   The chef was available to tell us about his dishes, the hostess told me about the best local outdoor wear shop (north end London bridge), our server Sophie was lovely and helped us understand some Britishisms, and our male server, whose name I missed, literally pointed me the way to walk down the street to the bridge.  I was high maintenance but no one treated me that way.It's a beautiful little spot and I recommend it, and for everyone's sake I hope Brexit doesn't hurt the livelihoods of any of the staff, who are all caring, skilled people who made our visit to London that much better.

photos.caption: Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom

5A28iIOAZ-ZKOI4CQILpJQ.text: Amazing amazing amazing! You have to book! They have indoor and outdoor the food and the service is awesome, I got the eggs with avocado and halloumi cheese it was really delicious, my boyfriend got a slightly larger dish which tasted amazing, he had beans, sausages and a lot more that I can't remember but it tasted so good with all an array of flavours! Would recommend this place and can't wait to go back, prices are also very reasonable for the location and quality! 100% recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom. Eggs Fallaw? (I can't remember the name) but trust me AMAZE BALLS

mH2MtCU9gxI49QD4tYbN7w.text: FINALLY. Ok, so I have been reading review after review about The Table and today I gave in and headed there to try it out and see what all the wonderful Yelpers were talking about and no surprise - they were right! We'd booked a table for 3 and were seated straight away on arrival. The place was PACKED and this was at 2pm on a Saturday. The rest of the area was basically empty so it was really cool actually to be a part of this buzzing and hustling atmosphere within The Table. I ordered The Stack for 3 reasons: 1. Ham hock and chorizo beans (say what?!) 2. Poached eggs 3. Hollandaise sauce! All piled on top of a bagel - I mean this is basically my breakfast dream and then it arrived... Mmmmm. It was fantastic - such an inventive collection of flavours! The beans I LOVED, the eggs were perfectly cooked and the hollandaise sauce was creamy perfection without being over heavy. My only negative and this is tiny is that the chorizo was plentiful and in some places slightly over powering BUT if you like chorizo you're in heaven and I still really enjoyed the dish overall. I also had a side of halloumi. The halloumi pieces were HUGE chunks - it seemed slightly burned for me but this was only in places and it was still very enjoyable. I must say my whole experience at The Table was a pleasure from start to finish and I would definitely recommend it.

photos.caption: Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom. Breakfast pancakes
Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom. Veggie breakfast with sausages instead of beans
Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom. The Stack

fIUzTyKNtaKS-3Mwd8sTPA.text: This is a really handy place almost next to where I work. If you're a breakfast/brunch fiend you'll love this place!There's a really good choice of sweet and savoury. Some firm favourites as well as more unusual combinations. There's things on toast, pancakes, waffles and more so I found it hard to choose. I decided to go for something a little different as I like to try new things.I went for the bacon, banana and maple syrup pancakes and I wasn't disappointed, although a little bit of me wished I'd gone for the full english pancakes as in hindsight I think I wanted savoury! It was delicious and the food all looked really good. 6 of us had breakfast and the food all arrived together and although it was reasonably busy in there, it didn't take too long (but long enough for it not to be suspicious that it's been sat there for ages or put in a microwave!).My colleague is a vegan and there wasn't anything on the menu that catered for her but she asked for the avocado, bacon and egg on toast without the bacon and egg and with lots of avocado. They put a whole avocado on her toast instead of half and charged £2.50 less so that was really good.It's a little on the pricey side but nice for a treat and I'd go again for sure. There's more on the menu I want to try out!

photos.caption: Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom. Must be good...sign in the window that it's in top 100 places to eat according to yelp!
Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom. Bacon, banana and maple pancakes

iHQnu51kpmnXEqeLxSpEeQ.text: Great place for english breakfast. I have tried the full english breakfast twice and veggie breakfast once and its always good. Coffee was ok. Service really depends on how crowded the place is but the servers are always very friendly. I saw quite a few people order vegan breakfast too and it looked good. They have tables outside so depending on the season there can be ample place to sit. Relaxed enviornment.

photos.caption: Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom. Veggie breakfast

6M79ncATt_KvWZzyaRllGw.text: Great food and good quick service. Very impressed with the way the staff worked together and accommodated our requests. Would eat here again.

5hljuiBYUhp6Jq-PXklkdQ.text: Delicious breakfasts! I was in London for a weekend and we came here for breakfast. The only reason they lose a star is because the service was not attentive at all. We had to plead for tap water. You have to wait to be seated and sometimes the servers are so busy that people just end up sitting, creating a big ol' mess!!! They offer boozey drinks, juices, smoothies, and coffees for beverages. We tried a smoothie and a latte. Latte was strong, smoothie was good. For our meals we ordered the classic English breakfast which came with sausage, beans, a mushroom, bacon, two fried eggs, and toast. Our second meal was the peanut butter, cox out, chocolate, marshmallow waffle.We were extremely full after our meal. I wish I had tried more plates like the bacon banana pancakes. From what we saw, the pancakes were small.The place has an open kitchen and the chefs all look very serious. If you are on this side of the river, make sure you give them a try! You won't regret it.

photos.caption: Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom. Latte
Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom. Breakfast for two
Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom. Classic breakfast, smoothie, latte, and waffle!!

TFDaCdRBPFINOaiAG2u4Aw.text: Good restaurant with nice indoor seating. The restaurant is quite noisy though. The food is good but nothing special. That's why I don't understand why people are qeueingbto get in. I would recommend this place for brunch, although I wouldn't wait outside in order to get a table.

V_WLCtO2kCQvahF3_Uy-rQ.text: Breakfast bruschetta is my choice of breakfast here. Without a doubt, having my fair share of brunches internationally, I will say they do this combo right with the pesto sauce as it combines with egg yolk to soak in the delicious sourdough for a great bite. Lattes and a honey mint teas with friends served as wonderful sides to a delicious Sunday London meal

photos.caption: Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom. Lattes and mint honey teas complete the meal

4ck7GmAqxHGd5FQ9d3urzw.text: This place is amazing for brunch! First of all, they have beautiful tulips on all the tables and large windows for lots natural light, which makes the ambiance really lovely. They also have very friendly staff, good coffee, and a nice selection of breakfast items. I had the poached eggs and bacon, and was very satisfied with the food and the overall experience.

UaORsKbXennfySeM0v-d8g.text: The atmosphere and decoration were great and chilling. The service was good and nice. We ordered the brioche French toast and the all-day breakfast pancake. It was really good and fulfill. The pancake was a bit crunchy on the side, the scramble eggs were delicious but the bacon was too much crunchy. The brioche French toast was full cinnamon and the yogurt on the top was good. I totally recommended for brunch !
