Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom. The Table's ranch burger

vbIlXHgiGXWL_GhwApzpRQ.text: The coffee came cold and the food warm at best, the waiters/waitresses had a lot of trouble remembering who our order was for so it just sat on the side for some time. The food tasted like upperclass motorway service station food, over all not worth the walk. Will not be making this my place of choice in the local area.

sjBuSYGjftsHUPdjXeDlJg.text: Long queue to get in. Once in, the service was prompt. The flat white is amazing, and so was the florentine and the veggie breakfast dish.

t_rHfBzsKeqmIpsThzfr2A.text: Decent quality breakfast and not expensive for London, but nothing to write home about. Digitally distorted music played too loud and varying between 80's dance hits and hair metal at 8:45am on a Sunday morning seemed a poor choice. No filter coffee, and people giving you the "Americano" option is a pet peeve of mine. A note to restauranteurs and cafe owners, they aren't alike and not good substitutes for one another.- Updated and added a star after Shaun's response. When the owners/managers are listening to feedback that's always a big plus. Shaun, no issue will hair metal, but for reference it was Quiet Riot's classic "Cum On Feel the Noise", great track, but in its proper place and setting!

SEYCzwPDoSPxM_lwfz-n5w.text: I love The Table!  Whether it's for a lazy brunch or a quick pit stop before hitting up The Tate Modern, this place is absolutely worth it.  They don't take reservations and like any place, the queue gets insane after 11.  But the pancakes are really good (and I'm an American - do you know how hard it is to get good pancakes in this city??) and the service is quite friendly and mostly speedy as well.  This place is a hot spot - it's in central Southwark and has "shared table" seating to maximize the space.  My only wish is that it took reservations!  But nonetheless, a fabulous spot to brunch.

gxGGX9D9Yrle1N0dkb9UEg.text: Thanks to being friends with Nida K., I occasionally try some great brunch places. I have a lot left to try, but I was excited to meet a few friends here to take in the food, since it seemed nice. The best part about going out with Yelpers/food lovers is that we go a bit overboard... among 4 ladies, we ordered:1. Banoffee Waffles2. Blueberry Banana Bread3. Eggs Benedict4. Eggs Florentine5. The Table Stack6. Sweetcorn Fritter and Poached EggAll looked delicious, all met the savory and/or sweet qualifications desired, and we left truly stuffed. I wish there was more waiting room, because a queue forms fast, but it's fun that there are communal tables and good service. The Table is, in the end, a nice Southbank/Southwark brunch option.

photos.caption: Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom. Banoffee Waffles
Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom. Blueberry Banana Bread

48poWupM8DEYQbhcXLV1MQ.text: They will not accommodate anyone with food allergies. The manager informed us that no restaurant in London can legally serve someone with allergies. Is that not discrimination.

ERHmmk8rFFwiL6PzWEuIFA.text: I'm flying out of the box on this one, but I couldn't possibly contain myself... The Table is arguably one of London's best brunch spots! What do I like? All of it. I don't even have any favorites, but in all sincerity it makes me giddy when I know I'm stopping by for some food. Local, organic, and sustainable. No need to buy me dinner, babe, I'm easy and this place is seductive as Nicole Scherzinger in a black and white music video, rolling around in the sheets in slow motion. No shit, right? Smother it all in warm butter, gravy, maple syrup, or hollandaise, whatever you want. I am powerless against The Table's simplicity and charm. The quality not rivaled by many, if any.If you crave traditional, they've got it. If you want something a bit different, slightly other worldly, they've got that. Want healthy? Got it. Feeling indulgent? Look no further! Please, just stop whatever it is you're doing at this very moment and go. It is so much more important that you eat here than whatever else it was you were doing before you read my review. What are you waiting for? Go!

bsCO0n0GnWjXNhUbfXB9qQ.text: I wanted to give this place more than 2 stars. It has all the initial appeal of a good, comfortable regular brekkie cafe. But unfortunately, the food just didn't quite make the cut. With a great feel about it, nice tables, good aspect and position, it's a shame that the food let it down. Very quick out, but I would happily have waited if it meant I had freshly cooked bacon.I had the Eggs Benedict. It looked promising, arriving on a massive plate and with a pleasing amount of hollandaise. The eggs were cooked perfectly, but that was it. Served on two cold muffins, that were more like stale scones and ate like stale bread. I would have liked something crunchier. Fresher. Toasted at the very least. The bacon was frazzled to within an inch of its life, rubbery and pre-cooked. The hollandaise was utterly forgettable, if a bit too lemony, not a good balance of favours all round. I will definitely come back, if only to sample something else. Service and the coffee both excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom. Eggs Benedict

yi1Qo7eMG3wDPrx_pQTmhQ.text: Very clean with good service and great for brunch."The Stack" is a really delicious and unique breakfast option; I would go back just for that.

JUcH9uPqe_Vxl4slgb3T9A.text: This is a lovely brunch place on Southwark Street. An elegant brunch menu is supported by an ambiance created by fun Londoners. The little outdoor space by the side is an added bonus.The scrambled eggs with salmon served on sourdough bread is divine. The Borough Full Breakfast (2 x fried eggs, bacon, pork and leek sausage, smoked baked beans, grilled tomato, Portobello mushroom and sourdough toast) is very filling; not a good idea if you're looking for something light.For what it is meant to be, I would have gladly given a 5 star rating except that what seemed like a delicious pancake, had an uncooked core. I mistook it for a custard stuffing of sorts until I tasted it and was put off. I'm going to give the Table Cafe the benefit of the doubt and deduct one star only.

photos.caption: Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom

2TJYejcv-x53m0mI2OJwRw.text: Amazing breakfast!!! Definitely make a reservation if you can. I got the stack and it was so good! Definitely would go back again. It very busy too, just keep that in mind.

E1ArKtCr_TKl2mwsFi-QBg.text: Items Selected:AmericanoCorn Fritters and Black PuddingBanoffee Waffle - Banana, ToffeeValrhona Chocolate Pancake with vanilla yogurt and seasonal berriesAs yet unaffected by jetlag having slept well and started the day with a 12-mile run along the Thames it was after a bit of right-sided driving that I found free parking in Saturday downtown London and with a spring in my step given an online menu full of promise I walked into Southwark's "The Table" only to experience the first of several 'bait-n-switch' breakfasts - in this case the aforementioned brunch menu over 6 months old with no figgy pudding or hot chocolate profiteroles currently to be found.  Admittedly disheartened but willing to make do given hunger pangs, the trappings of free Wi-Fi, and a staff unabashedly apologetic for mistakes reportedly unbeknownst till that day it was after several questions that an order was crafted and with good coffee, a rarity in England, soon in hand a short wait would see all three plates arrive at once...my fault for not specifying a more leisurely pace, or so it would seem.  Obviously a touch more 'American' than many breakfasts that would follow it was largely with an eye on diversity that my meal took shape and although I personally found the famous fried corn to be far more filler than 'fritter' I'd be hard pressed to find fault in any of the rest - the black pudding toothsome and rich with its signature sapor while a crispy golden waffle shined under the savory sort of toffee not often seen on the other side of the Atlantic  Undoubtedly a hearty meal even without other desired delicacies it was only after sampling the more regional fare that I finally delved into the oven finished pancake that came highly praised by my young server and with a toothsome texture rife in buttermilk beneath bursting berries, light yogurt, and molten dark chocolate suffice it to say my sweet tooth was satisfied...though I still hold a grudge considering the online menu continues to taunt with its offer of brunch figgy pudding at the time of this writing.

photos.caption: Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom. Valrhona Chocolate Pancake with vanilla yogurt and seasonal berries
Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom. Valrhona Chocolate Pancake with vanilla yogurt and seasonal berries
Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom. Banoffee Waffle - Banana, Toffee

Q5NNbCHgiRPd6phQbQ6TYg.text: Right now this must be the best brunch place in London in terms of the quality of the food. The food is just amazing. The full veggie breakfast is probably the best vegetarian "full English" I have ever had. You won't miss the meat, as the grilled haloumi and the really meaty mushrooms give a lot of texture. Even the grilled tomatoes are "just right", firm and great tasting, not the runny mess you sometimes get, so the quality of the ingredients is superb. Big portion too. I could eat this every day.I also can recommend their waffles - to die for. I had the blueberry waffle, which is packed with blueberries on top, great maple syrup and indulgent sweet cream as well, making it just heavenly good. No skimping on the ingredients, it's a heavenly mess. And even the waffle is crispy soft like it should be (but where few succeed).On the negative side the room is very tightly packed with people - the guy sitting next to me last time I was here was shouting so hard to to his girlfriend across the table my ear hurt. No manners. The environment is nothing special, just a room with tables. Service is good too overall, fast and attentive, but if you come on your own they try and stuff you away at a sort of bar by the door (meaning you'll be cold and have the door slam next to you!). And when you ask not to sit there they look really bothered and not welcoming - always. That's not a great way to treat customers! But considering the extremely great food, the behaviour was worth it.Overall, this would probably be a not so great place considering the above, but whoever the chefs are, and whoever sources their ingredients, make this a five star place as the food is just that awesome.

8Q2-q-kOFB4EwRH5vi3epw.text: I've been in SO MANY coffee places around the world, this is NOT a "coffee shop" or a "coffee house".First - the coffee not so good. It's OK, under the average.Anyway, when I only ordered coffee the waitress came every minute and tried to make me order food (although the place was totally empty, not like I was taking a spot of a "spender" who's waiting outside).I ordered some sort of desert which wasn't so good as well and kinda messed my stomach.Anyway, the vibe WAS NOT nice, coffee house should have very friendly with nice vibe. This place might be an restaurant, maybe with a small twist of "brasserie" and a "diner", but not a coffee shop.After a cold vibe from the staff, I didn't stayed long (although had my laptop and planned on working a little bit).If you looking for good place in LDN, I recommend "look mum no hands" and "Bar Italia" at the Soho.

WQU0M_t_JiO3Yb7p4vr6eQ.text: Nice place - light, airy, and casually elegant.  The coffee was good, although there was an odd discrepancy between the price listed on the menu (£3 for a regular flat white) and the £2.50 we paid.  I prefer the £2.50.  Brunch was delicious, with the lemon sugar pancake serving as a reasonable substitute for our beloved lemon ricotta pancakes from Cafeteria in New York.  And the corn fritters with poached eggs were good too, although the fritters could have used more corn and less dough.  Overall, though, a very good, relaxed, fun place for a weekend brunch.

lZPvM1EwyLuaLYwKOEaGSA.text: I had the Bannoffee waffles and my husband had the Vegetarian Borough. They were very filling and overall good, but the waffles were a little too sweet for me. The place is always packed, so be prepared to sit very close to a stranger as everyone just shares benches.

photos.caption: Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom. Bannoffee Waffles and Vegetarian Borough

q9gygfa1SwTltmYeRwzm0A.text: The Table is a short walk from Tate Modern and is geared towards the brunch market - waffles, pancakes, eggs etc.I had a vegetarian breakfast which included fresh and high quality ingredients, and also had some sweetcorn-based savoury cake which came with a tomato relish.That was all great.  Unfortunately it took too long to pay the bill at the end, hence the 3 stars.

glyZmGaQ_jfBqciBOiuUHA.text: I've been away from London for a little over 5 weeks, and decided to have a brunch catch up with the girls to gossip about the past few weeks. I did a quick google search for brunch just in london, haha we live fairly spread out, so are willing to travel up to 40mins. The Table popped up, and we decided to meet there at 12pm on a Sunday. I had expected to wait in line to be seated, as with most places that don't take bookings, you generally have to wait. My friends arrived early and managed to be seated right away, WINNING!!! Once i arrived, I was overwhelmed by the delicious looking food, and the amount of food on the menu. There was so much choice. I settled on the breakfast bruschetta, the other ordered the corn fittas, and the pancake with meats. The food came out fairly quickly, and the serving sizes are quite generous for the prices. Everything tasted amazing. I had food envy of the pancakes, and will definitely be back to order those. The only negative was when we wanted to leave and pay the bill, it took quite a lot of time. However the staff did applogise, so I wasn't too put off by it.

I_tFdS4H_Dz-hHQOalQQrw.text: I've enjoyed 2 great meals at this location. The pancakes with scrambled eggs were delicious.  The best eggs (not runny or dry...perfect) I have had in London thus far.  They serve breakfast all day as well as some delicious looking lunch items.   Check this little place out.

photos.caption: Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom. Eggs florentine...yum

fodgjZEbl44a0SaeDk9rqQ.text: I came here this morning for brunch around 11am.  It was very busy, but we didn't have to wait which was a plus!I ordered 'The Stack' which consists of: two poached eggs with hollandaise on top of chorizo beans on top of a bagel.  I thought the plating was unique.  The eggs were perfectly poached (with a delicious runny yolk.) The entire meal didn't blow my mind, but it was good.  I definitely plan on coming back, but may opt for a sweeter meal as the pancakes and waffles looked like a foodgasm waiting to happen!Definitely a solid brunch spot in London - good service, good ambiance, and great location.

gKWClc_3hCO9PA_McdIYew.text: Walking around London Bridge area, and (thanks to Yelp!) this was one of the only places open early for breakfast. The staff is friendly, helpful and the vibe is positive. Perfect if you're looking for a nice option near Tate Modern. Recommend coming early for the French Toast!

o3dwQHGd9yRcEyIvoCQ8zw.text: Great atmosphere coupled by delicious food! I had the Sweetcorn Fritters with the refreshing breakfast Belline. If you stop by during the weekend, say hello to Paulo, the sweetest Brazilian you will ever meet.

photos.caption: Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom. Delicious!!

BZ4q1oQ6hTUcSNgxy40GVQ.text: Overpriced mediocre food in cold, loud atmosphere. This review needs to be longer, though there is not much more to say.

7W6DDk7U6wyc-VLCgk-SmA.text: Service was slow and food was good but not great. They were really nice, however! I'd recommend if you like a nice dining area with a street view of the busy city and don't mind relaxing and chatting during the wait.

HLK4qVWBXRLfo2pOSInotA.text: + morning glory was a refreshing smoothie, not too sweet+ pork and leek sausages in the full English were excellent, as were the baked beans and the grilled tomato+ open, casual cafe style- full English was trying to be too healthy, which is a bit of a paradox- slow service. It took nearly 15 minutes from being brought my menu for the server to take my order. Another 20-25 to get the cheque after requesting it on 4 separate occasions

wbZ1sdhIkAo285xkZoyGgw.text: I have had the Table on my list of places to go for brunch a long time and since it is the final weeks of living within easy walking distance I decided to go for it. Actually even reserved seats to be sure to get a spot. Was definitely a good idea as the place was packed already around 10 on a Saturday. It does not look like much when entering, I do more get a feel of chain such as Vapiano or Sig and Lettuce as the decor is very uninspiring. We were promptly seated, fairly uncomfortable high tables with nowhere to hang coats but fortunately we did not come here for the decor or seats. We quickly glanced at the menu and since I was really starving I went for the Full English. The pork and leek sausages were really great and the same for the tomatoes that were grilled but yet firm and flavorful (maybe it is just me but i struggle to appreciated most cooked vegetables as I often dislike the texture), the rest (mushrooms, beans, eggs and toast) were standard and the bacon was a bit disappointing as it was rather dry (not crisp). My better half went for the blueberry cream waffles and those were standard, nothing special at all.Did not even try to order the coffee as I had a look at the beans and quickly gathered that no amount of skill can produce good coffee from that type charcoal beans so ordered tea instead. The tea was ok but in general I expect a decent restaurant to serve loose leaf teas instead using tea bags.Update after the owner's little comment - I guess people's opinion of coffee may differ but that it is Allpress they are serving is at least no in my view a sign of quality (see my review of Allpress, yelp.com/biz/allpress-es…) but I am sure there are people who like it (I prefer other London roasters like Workshop, Tap or Notes every day of the week). As for the tea - still not impressed, if it was loose leaf tea inside the tea bags it surely did not result in a great cup of tea. That said will perhaps give the place another chance.So the food is perhaps slightly better than average but the prices are also a bit higher than average so in this area on Saturday  I would rather walk over to the Maltby street market for Breakfast waffles or a stop at Bea's.

bYgd6d5FLQFSiSyDPmiXSQ.text: Friendly staff and environment. If you would like to come and have some fun during lunch or dinner hours, better reserve in advance.

photos.caption: Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom

EqBCTJg_gszyzxaZK9B9Pg.text: Great food and service . Hit the spot. My family and I are from America and I wasn't sure what to expect of an English breakfast. This both gave us the cultural English breakfast experience and filled us up with good food.

L0778czwepyhuHFrcCA0Nw.text: Absolutely divine food at sensible prices for the area.Service was top notch. In fact, the waiter was very helpful in recommendations and extremely attentive to our table, despite having quite a full lunchtime crowd to deal with.2 courses are £11.50, 3 courses are £13.50. Superb value and dishes arrive quickly and well presented. No worries about over-extended lunches here. I had grilled lamb, cooked just over pink, which I like. Too pink is not for me. The sauces, tasty and the spinach with lemon juice and home-made pesto just stunning.Topped all off with a fabulous blueberry almond tart and ice cream. I'll definitely be back to try the Caesar Salad and other specials + breakfast which I here is good.I would absolutely whole-heartedly recommend this place if you're a fan of ottolenghi. It's not quite as good food wise, but given the relative pricing and in my opinion better interior, a welcome change every now and then. It help it's literally just behind the office too!

photos.caption: Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom. Blueberry almond tart with ice cream
Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom. Grilled Lamb Special with Spinach, Home-made Pesto and Lemon
Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom. N'duja chorizo starter

WkCs3_JB3GBJjBVwPNAV0w.text: I already really enjoyed this brunch place when I checked it out for the first time in 2015. When I went back again a couple of weeks ago, it managed to totally outdo itself and firmly place itself in my top 3 brunch places in London list. My friend & I shared the Brioche French Toast (AMAZING!) and the Belle Helene Waffles. Both were so tasty that we were seriously considering ordering another plate (even though we were totally stuffed already). Can't wait to go back there again.

B1OrPtpFZvN7EJusKTIkfA.text: Brunch Brunch Brunch. My new weekend routine brought me to The Table last week. The restaurant isn't very big, but it's filled with large communal tables and an open kitchen. Our group of 4 girls terrorized the menu and ordered a dish for ourselves and two to share. We started with the Banoffee Waffles & the Blueberry banana bread. Both were winners! A little too much sweet for one person but great as a starter to share around the table! Our own individual dishes started to arrive around the table, a range from chorizo, beans to eggs benedict and florentine, to sweet corn fritters. It may not be the best place for brunch in London, but it definitely isn't a bad choice. Get there early, because when we left there was a queue out the door.

photos.caption: Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom. Eggs Benedict
Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom. The Stack
Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom. Eggs Florentine

ViFp4y78TUP-qK6vhuic9Q.text: I've eaten at the table quite a few times years back. Seeing it was open (previous times they had reduced opening days and times) I had to eat here.The food is always simply brilliant. You can tell the care and love of food here. No question about that. Tonight though, the service was what let it down ultimately. Servers outside having smoke breaks throughout service. Okay, the place wasn't mobbed, but still, it's mid service and doesn't give a good impression when no one is around. What annoys me more at restaurants, is adding in a 12.5% service charge to a table of two. Automatically taken off your card when you pay. Firstly, you hardly earned it and secondly, it should apply to tables over six. I would have left a tip anyway, I always do. That should be determined by me though, not you.The stars are for the food. Zero for service and care and attention. It's no wonder the place is empty on the evening...You Don't Gotta Eat Here...

photos.caption: Photo of The Table - London, United Kingdom. Grilled lamb

49SSH8YV63Jk_iu_yJbxKA.text: First thing I will say about The Table Cafe is that it is busy. If you can make a reservation then please do but if not the staff are super friendly and will do their utmost to squeeze you in. I mean that literally. While there are a few tables set for four the place is mainly made up of long sharing tables so unless you're a larger group it's very likely you'll end up sharing with strangers which can make things a bit difficult when it comes to who ordered what but more on that later.We were very lucky in that they were able to seat us right away but it did mean sharing a table of four with another twosome of diners. Our drinks order was taken very quickly and we were soon presented with a milkshake for my friend and my own glass of prosecco.A few minutes later we were also given a bottle of water which I thought was great given that we hadn't asked for it but I was quite thirsty so poured a glass only to realise after taking a sip that it was sparkling. It was at this point that the men we were sharing the table with mentioned to their server (who was different from our server!) that they hadn't been given their sparkling water that we put two and two together and figured out that the water we'd just been given was not in fact complimentary but was meant for them. Oops! Luckily the server understood and everything was quickly sorted. I can imagine that this happens quite a bit when they have different groups end up sharing as we were.To eat my friend went for the pancakes with crispy bacon, caramelised banana and Canadian maple syrup which she had been craving that morning and was the reason I stumbled upon this place on Zomato.For myself, while I wanted to be a bit more adventurous and try The Stack I really hate beans and didn't think it would be quite the same without them so ended up having the salmon and scrambled eggs. While not as good as my mums scrambled eggs (I've yet to come across any that are) these are definitely the closest I've found in London. They were light and creamy and just melted in your mouth. Every last morsel was cleared from both plates and if that doesn't convince you how good it was nothing will!It took a while for us to get the bill (the till ran out of paper just as they were trying to get some of them) and then even longer to pay but given how busy this place is it's not surprising that the service can slip a little at times. Overall though it was a great meal and I would definitely like to return.

KQ_6ssBvmcUnPZKsKeS8yQ.text: Best English Breakfast...skip the cliche Breakfast Club and walk a little further to find this great brunch place. The portions are substantial and the taste is amazing. You will not be disappointed.

36tNO35TE_3aGlpwMy3UnA.text: This restaurant is extremely delicious!! Such a flavor party in my mouth. The service was really fast on a busy Saturday and you get a free espresso shot with your first check-in - amazing. I knocked one star off because I sat at the bar table facing the hallway outside and literally had the people standing in line watching me eat. Maybe a window shade is required when the lineup is long. You must come here.
